contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Vale royal abbey.jpg|thumb|250px|right|[[Vale Royal Abbey|Vale Royal Great House]], the former seat of the Barons Delamere.]] '''Baron Delamere''', of [[Vale Royal Abbey|Vale Royal]] in the County of Chester, is a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1821 for [[Thomas Cholmondeley, 1st Baron Delamere|Thomas Cholmondeley]], a former [[Member of Parliament]] for [[Cheshire (UK Parliament constituency)|Cheshire]]. This Vale Royal branch of the Cholmondeley family descends from Thomas Cholmondeley (died 1653), younger brother of [[Robert Cholmondeley, 1st Earl of Leinster]] and Hugh Cholmondeley (1591–1665), ancestor of the [[Marquess of Cholmondeley|Marquesses of Cholmondeley]]. The first Baron was succeeded by his son. Before acceding to the title in 1855, the second Baron represented [[Denbighshire (UK Parliament constituency)|Denbighshire]] and [[Montgomery (UK Parliament constituency)|Montgomery]] in the [[British House of Commons|House of Commons]] as a [[Tory]]. His eldest son, also named Hugh, acceded to the title in 1887 and in the same year, he emigrated to [[Kenya]], where he acquired a major estate. The third Baron's eldest son inherited his father's title in 1931. In 1934, he attempted to re-establish his family at Vale Royal, the family's country home and baronial seat from the 17th century; however, the great house was requisitioned as a sanatorium during the war years.<ref>Holland, G.D ''et al.'' (1977). ''Vale Royal Abbey and House,'' p. 32; Westair-Reproductions: [https://id409.van.ca.siteprotect.com/westair-reproductions/mappage/cheshire.htm Cheshire, Museum finder]</ref> When it was sold in 1947, the fourth Baron returned to Kenya. {{As of|2010}} the title is held by the fifth Baron, who succeeded his father in 1979. He also lives in Kenya. The family surname is pronounced {{IPAc-en|ˈ|tʃ|ʌ|m|l|i}}. ==Barons Delamere (1821)== *[[Thomas Cholmondeley, 1st Baron Delamere]] (1767–1855) *[[Hugh Cholmondeley, 2nd Baron Delamere]] (1811–1887) *[[Hugh Cholmondeley, 3rd Baron Delamere]] (1870–1931) *[[Thomas Cholmondeley, 4th Baron Delamere|Thomas Pitt Hamilton Cholmondeley, 4th Baron Delamere]] (1900–1979) *[[Hugh Cholmondeley, 5th Baron Delamere|Hugh George Cholmondeley, 5th Baron Delamere]] (b. 1934) The [[heir apparent]] is the present title holder's son the Hon.
